website_summaries.verdict: This pool alarm is designed to help you determine if there is an extra dangerous electric charge in your pool or other swimming area.
pros: Good for use near pool lighting
Helps to make sure there is not extra electrical current in your pool water
It is able to work in salt water or off a dock at a lake as well as in your pool at home
cons: This unit does not come with a tether

customer_reviews.title: Saves lives!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 4 of these as a donation to our local sheriff's office at Lake Anna, Virginia! There have been incidents unfortunately where people have drowned due to electric shock. Best brand specifically is currently being used at lake Anna because they have already worked to save numerous lives. Which is why they asked specifically for this brand. If saving a life isn't enough of a review I don't know what is.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne

customer_reviews.title: Do I trust this, probably not
customer_reviews.text: There is no indicator light saying it is working or that the batteries are not dead, in fact it could just be a plastic stick without anything inside and I would never know. So in the end I am not sure I would trust this with my families life at our lake dock.
customer_reviews.author: Josh C

customer_reviews.title: This product was received as non-functioning.
customer_reviews.text: The box was received from Amazon without any manual, without the side wall connector and did not function. Also the package was previously opened and had the button floating around in the box. This was likely a previously returned item. I only just found this out as I opened the box for a pool inspection ... poor experience ... this is likely more of an issue with AMAZON shipping!!!! not happy with how this product was received.
customer_reviews.author: Bad_Dog_No_Bskt

customer_reviews.title: Safety is our priority
customer_reviews.text: Great comfort for our dock on the lake with lots of folks swimming nearby.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Clark

customer_reviews.title: It saves lives.
customer_reviews.text: It works! If you have any body of water where there is power near the water it’s a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Skg

customer_reviews.title: Hope it works
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it’s worth the money, can’t tell if it actually works I need your tester to see if it actually works could be just a PVC pipe with batteries in it for $100
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will not work in less that 12 inches of water.
customer_reviews.text: I read in the instructions the depth was a factory. So, I returned the product without using it.
customer_reviews.author: jmcewen

customer_reviews.title: Glad to have this safety device in place.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 and gave them to the kids for their pools.
customer_reviews.author: Bee

customer_reviews.title: It does what it said will do. It prevented from someone in my family to get hurt.
customer_reviews.text: Good packaging and it worked out of the bag. I had problems with my pool light and was detected by the Shock Alarm. Thank you. Miguel
customer_reviews.author: Miguel A. Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the safety of our swimmer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and it worked well when we tested the power on/off in the water
customer_reviews.author: Dena S. Berte

customer_reviews.title: I never knew such a thing existed and it terrified me to think a fun day at the lake could turn into something bad
customer_reviews.text: I purchaed a ShockAlarm after seeing several segments on morning news programs regarding Electric Shock Drowning. I never knew such a thing existed and it terrified me to think a fun day at the lake could turn into something bad. Thanksfully, I havent had a need for it to do its job, but when I tested it with my phone charger, it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Bouvier

customer_reviews.title: works well but limited life span
customer_reviews.text: The good: This product works well, is easy to use and is portable. It offers protection from electric shock drowning and allows you to check for electric current around your boat which can cause electrical oxidation damage to your running gear. The bad: The battery is not replaceable. The company states that the battery can last 12 to 18 months continuously on and possibly longer if turned off. Turning off means placing a magnet to a piece of velcro on the device. Simple off solution that I never followed. To be fair, the device lasted for about two years constant on.
customer_reviews.author: mel

product_meta.title: ShockAlarm- Electric Shock Drowning Protection for Pools, Boats, & Marinas
product_meta.description: ShockAlarm is a floating, monitoring alarm that protects your family, friends, and pets from Electrical Shock Drowning. It detects stray electrical currents that are potentially dangerous. This is a passive device which means it isn’t connected to an electrical system that could pose added dangers when around water. Once activated, the ShockAlarm will monitor for electric current constantly.
feature_bullets: Easy to Test- Remove red magnet and point base towards cell phone charger (charger plugged into outlet)
Battery Saver-Reattach red magnet to save battery life.
Easily store with other pool and boating supplies during the off season

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars41 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
